images.caption: Figure 1:Experimental pipeline for evaluating taste-based music generation. The Taste & Affect Music Database is modified and used to fine-tune MusicGEN, resulting in a Fine-tuned MusicGEN model. Both the base and fine-tuned models generate music using taste-based prompts. The generated stimuli are then evaluated through two experimental tasks: (A) a comparison between baseline and fine-tuned models, and (B) a semantic differential analysis of the fine-tuned stimuli.
(a)Survey’s task A interface, where participants express song preference.
(a)Survey’s task A interface, where participants express song preference.
Figure 3:Distribution of the task A results, where a score of zero means a strong preference for the base model, while a score of 10 means a strong preference for the fine-tuned model.
(a)Heatmap of perceived taste in correspondence of the intended one.
(a)Heatmap of perceived taste in correspondence of the intended one.
(b)Heatmap of perceived emotional response in correspondence of the suggested taste.
